* A class that represents a date and time to be used by Task objects.
* Creates a new DukeDateTime instance according to the input arguments.
* @param date A LocalDate representing the date of the DukeDateTime
* @param time A LocalTime representing the time of the DukeDateTime
* A check for whether an instance of a DukeDateTime actually encodes date-time data.
* @return true is both date and time properties are null and false otherwise
* Generates a String representing this instance of DukeDateTime.
* If both date and time fields are null, will return "Unspecified Time".
* If only one field is null, only the other field will be printed.
* If both fields are non-null, will print the date followed by the time.
* A class that represents a duration in time to be used by Task classes.
* Creates a new DukeDuration according to the input arguments.
* @param startDateTime DukeDateTime containing the date and time at which the duration begins
* @param endDateTime DukeDateTime containing the date and time at which the duration ends
* Generates a String representing this instance of DukeDuration.
* If both startDateTime and endDateTime are null, will return "Unspecified Time".
* If only the first field is non-null, will print the starting date-time of the duration.
* If both fields are non-null, will print both fields delimited by a " to ".

* A class that handles text formatting for Duke's responses to the user.
* Formats a String to look nicer when printed to the console. Generally, this method should also be
* called whenever a call is made to one of DukeUi's messages.
* @param inputString The String to be printed to the console.
//Indents each line of the String to be formatted
* A class that stores all of Duke's mesages as Strings. These are split into Greetings, Feedback and Error Messages.
= "Heya! It's friendly neighbourhood Duke at your service!\nWhat's the plan today?";
= "Alright, see you again!\nGood luck, and do your best!";
= "You've got no tasks on your list!";
= "Gotcha! I've added a new task:\n  %s\nYou've got %d tasks in your list.";
= "Good job! I've marked this task as done:\n  %s";
= "No problem! I've deleted the task:\n %s\nYou've got %d tasks in your list.";
= "Boom! I've deleted all of your tasks!";
= "Scan complete! I've got your tasks right here: \n%s";
= "Hmm, yes. I totally get it!\n(Doesn't get it at all.)";
= "You're lacking something in your '%s' command, frendo.";
= "Umm, The hours don't go below 0, or above 23...";
= "Umm, the minutes don't go below 0, or above 59...";
= "I dunno if you write your lists starting from before 1,\nbut I sure don't.";
= "Oh! The fabled '%d' on the list!\n(It's fabled so it doesn't exist)...";
= "When I enter the mirror time dimension,\nI also count days starting from zero.";
= "Wow, I never knew the month of %s had so many days!";
= "When I enter the mirror time dimension,\nI also count months starting from zero.";
= "The months go November, December, Januember, Februember...";
= "You need to give me a number to work with, not just '%s'.";
= "Keep your secrets. I'll keep my list clean.\n(pout)";
